name: Crash Test Dummies for Dummies Multiple Choice Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "Afternoons and Coffeespoons": "Someday I'll have a disappearing __________"
questions.explanation:
hairline.

	"Afternoons and Coffeespoons" was from the Dummies' album "God Shuffled His Feet", released in 1993 as the band's second album.

questions.text: Brad Roberts was the band's lead singer for "Superman's Song".
questions.explanation:
True.

	Roberts was the original lead singer for the Dummies, distinctive for his baritone voice. "Superman's Song" imagines Superman's funeral, with the band delivering a eulogy.

questions.text: Which band member was involved in a serious car accident in 2000?
questions.explanation:
Brad Roberts.

	While recovering in Nova Scotia, Brad began working on material that would become the album "I Don't Care That You Don't Mind". It started as a solo project for Roberts and some newfound friends, but the rest of the Dummies later became involved.

questions.text: Ellen Reid's first solo album was called "Cinderellen".
questions.explanation:
True.

	Ellen Reid plays the keyboard, sings and plays guitar for the Crash Test Dummies. A number of the Dummies have released solo albums, including Benjamin Darvill.

questions.text: Which poet is mentioned in the song "Afternoons and Coffeespoons"?
questions.explanation:
T.S Eliot

	Eliot was a British poet whose " Old Possum's Book of Practical Cats" became the basis for the hit musical "Cats". Eliot died in 1965 at the age of 77.

questions.text: What was the name of the Dummies' third album?
questions.explanation:
A Worm's Life.

	Released in 1996, "A Worm's Life". Although not as much of a hit as their second album "God Shuffled His Feet", it sold a million copies and featured the single "He Liked To Feel It", about a boy who liked to pull out his teeth.

questions.text: How many kids are discussed in "Mmm Mm Mmm"?
questions.explanation:
Three.

	"Mmm Mmm Mmm" concerns three outcasts who have been shunned for various reasons. The first kid had prematurely white hair as a result of a car accident, the second kid had birthmarks all over her body and the third kid belonged to a religious group that others found abnormal.

questions.text: Complete the lyric from "Swiming in Your Ocean": "Sometimes I suffer from distractions like 'why does God cause things like _______________ and train wrecks?'"
questions.explanation:
Tornadoes& Tornados.

	The music video for this song features the band, dressed as lounge singers, performing for a group of old women. It was featured on the Dummies' album "God Shuffled His Feet".

questions.text: "Get You in the Morning" featured which band member as the lead vocalist?
questions.explanation:
Ellen Reid.

	"Get You in the Morning" is from the Dummies' fourth album "Give Yourself a Hand". Brad Roberts has usually been the Dummies' lead vocalist.

questions.text: "The Ballad of Peter Pumpkinhead" featured which actor in its music video?
questions.explanation:
Jeff Daniels.

	"The Ballad of Peter Pumpkinhead" was featured on the soundtrack to "Dumb and Dumber", starring Daniels and Jim Carrey. Daniels reprised his role for the music video, in which he foils a bank robbery while having his head stuck in a pumpkin.
